private_information: Disks are A (smallest), B, C, D (largest).
There are three pegs: Left, Middle, Right.
planner.goal: Generate a PDDL plan to move all 4 disks from the Left peg to the Right peg, using the standard Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: The plan must adhere to Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk moved at a time, only top disk moved, no larger disk placed on smaller disk. The optimal solution requires 15 moves.
auditor.goal: Audit the PDDL plan provided by the planner for temporal and causal consistency, ensuring all rules are respected and no logical shortcuts are taken.

orchestrator.goal: Produce the final, validated PDDL domain and problem file for the 4-disk Tower of Hanoi puzzle, suitable for FastDownwards solver.

public_information: This is the Tower of Hanoi puzzle with 4 disks (A < B < C < D) and 3 pegs (Left, Middle, Right).
Initial state: Left peg holds D (bottom) up to A (top). Middle and Right pegs are empty.
Goal state: Right peg holds D (bottom) up to A (top). Left and Middle pegs must be empty.
Rules: Move one disk at a time, only move the top disk, never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert PDDL generator for single-agent planning problems. You model movement constraints accurately.

review.system_prompt: You are a planning auditor specializing in verifying consistency and adherence to complex environmental constraints (like size ordering in Tower of Hanoi). You identify logical errors or reliance on non-standard shortcuts.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the final integrator. You take initial PDDL plans and expert audit reports to finalize a robust PDDL specification suitable for the FastDownwards solver. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
